body: Six wins from their last eight games have propelled Southampton up the table and they know victory tomorrow could be enough for them to steal sixth, and even possibly fifth place. Alan Pardew returns to a club where he had perhaps his least impressive spell in management with next Saturday’s FA Cup final on his mind, even more so after Joe Ledley’s unfortunate leg-break against Stoke last week, so an under-strength Crystal Palace side is a distinct possibility. Paul Chronnell Kick-off Sunday 3pm  Venue St Mary’s Stadium Last season Southampton 1 Crystal Palace 0 Referee Michael Oliver This season G25, Y89, R5, 3.96 cards per game Odds H 1-3 A 8-1 D 9-2 Southampton Subs from Stekelenburg, Gazzaniga, Soares, Yoshida, Clasie, Ward-Prowse, Pellè, Austin, Juanmi Doubtful Mané (illness), Clasie (ankle)  Injured None Suspended None Form LWDWWW Discipline Y59 R6 Leading scorers Long, Mané, Pellè 10 Crystal Palace Subs from Hennessey, McCarthy, Dann, Hangeland, Souaré, Cabaye, Bolasie, Scales, Puncheon, Jedinak, Lee, Wickham, Campbell, Williams Doubtful Jedinak (knock), Hangeland (match fitness), Bolasie (illness), Cabaye (ribs), Dann (foot) Injured Zaha (buttock, 21 May), Ledley (shin, June), Anderson (leg, Aug), Appiah (knee, Aug), Chamakh (groin, Aug) Suspended None Form WDDLLW Discipline Y59 R2 Leading scorers Bolasie, Cabaye, Dann, Wickham 5
webTitle: Southampton v Crystal Palace: match preview
